remarks: Lemma for ~ 2sq .  If a number that is a sum of two squares is divisible by a prime that is a sum of two squares, then the quotient is a sum of two squares.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
statement:
2sq.1 $e |- S = ran ( w e. Z[i] |-> ( ( abs ` w ) ^ 2 ) ) $.
2sqlem5.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
2sqlem5.2 $e |- ( ph -> P e. Prime ) $.
2sqlem5.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( N x. P ) e. S ) $.
2sqlem5.4 $e |- ( ph -> P e. S ) $.
2sqlem5 $p |- ( ph -> N e. S ) $.
